title: downcast to reference "impossible case reached"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I had some code that was downcasting an owned Box<MyTrait> to a concret owned value. That code worked fine. Today I tried to change it to downcast and then borrow.

I added this code:

https://github.com/mdg/leema/commit/886ca6c0ead2c99b093bf8aaf7881ba1548ac5ff#diff-04a0e2a8850f0ecfdb57f8f00aaea52fR111
I've pushed all this code up to the [downcast-reference-bug branch](https://github.com/mdg/leema/blob/downcast-reference-bug/src/leema/rsrc.rs#L111) in my repo.

I expected to see this happen: 
convert to the new value, and then return a reference to it

Instead, this happened: I got an internal compiler error
`error: internal compiler error: librustc/traits/structural_impls.rs:176: impossible case reached`

I suspect this is probably doable if I do it correctly, but the error message requested a bug report so here it is.

## Meta

```
[mdg@localhost leema]$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.28.0 (9634041f0 2018-07-30)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 9634041f0e8c0f3191d2867311276f19d0a42564
commit-date: 2018-07-30
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.28.0
LLVM version: 6.0
```

Backtrace:
```

cargo build --bin leema
```
